love the look of knit stitches but only crochet? these socks use unique crochet stitches to mimic the knit and purl stitches. it also creates a flexible and comfortable fabric. 

for this pattern, using fingering weight yarn really lets this stitch show off its definition with an amazing drape. 

**video tutorial:**
[https://youtu.be/vygn0onmkbe][1]

**crochet hook:**
[2.5 & 3.5 mm crochet hooks][2], or size to obtain gauge

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers if needed][3]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][4]
[scissors][5]

**yarn:**
[wecrochet stroll tonal][6]
75% fine superwash merino wool, 25% nylon, 462 yds/100g

**yardage:**
colorways in images: purlescent, seashell
ankle socks (250yds/228m), mid calf socks 375yds/343m) -  1 hank
over the knee socks (775yds/709m) - 2 hanks

**abbreviations/stitches:**
blo - back loop only
ch - chain
est st pat - established stitch pattern
rnd - round
sc - single crochet
ssc - split single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)

**gauge:**
20 sts x  25 rows = 4x4 inches in established stitch pattern, see notes.
the stitches per inch is 5

**skill level:**
beginner/easy

**size/measurements:**
the simple sock video tutorial and the written pattern will follow an example sock for stitch counts. this example sock will fit a foot circumference of 8 inches, however adjust these as needed.
a sock schematic is available in the pattern. get the free downloadable charts here: [https://brianakdesigns.com/how-to-size-crochet-socks/][7]
